nucky.share
Class Like

java.lang.Object
  nucky.share.Like

public class Like
extends java.lang.Object

A class that allows to put a mark on a Processing sketch. Once the user submits his vote, it displays the average mark.
To vote and display the result, it is also possible to use a custom GUI or a GUI library.
The library requires a PHP/MySQL server with the share library PHP scripts, and the SQL table properly installed.

Author:
Nucky

Constructor Detail

Like

public Like(processing.core.PApplet parent,
            java.lang.String url,
            int pollId)
     throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new Like voting box with 5 different marks (5 buttons).

Parameters:
parent - The Processing sketch to use and draw to (usually this)
url - URL where the PHP script and SQL are installed properly
pollId - An ID number > 0 that separates different sketches from each others, or groups of different sketches from each others, so mean values are useful
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL's syntax is not correct
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pollId <= 0

Like

public Like(processing.core.PApplet parent,
            java.lang.String url,
            int pollId,
            int highestMark)
     throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new Like voting box with highestMark different marks.

Parameters:
parent - The Processing sketch to use and draw to (usually this)
url - URL where the PHP script and SQL are installed properly
pollId - An ID number > 0 that separates different sketches from each others, or groups of different sketches from each others, so mean values are useful
highestMark - The highest possible mark (number of buttons) between 2 and 9 inclusive
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL's syntax is not correct
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pollId <= 0
Method Detail

setBounds

public void setBounds(int x,
                      int y,
                      int w,
                      int h)
Sets the position and size of the voting box. Note that the box will always be big enough to contain the label.

Parameters:
x - x position of the box
y - y position of the box
w - width of the box
h - height of the box

setLabel

public void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
Sets the label of the voting box, a message to invite the user to give his advice

Parameters:
label - the message to display

setColors

public void setColors(int backGround,
                      int foreGround,
                      int hover)
Sets the colors of the voting box. You can use the color() method of Processing to get a valid color

Parameters:
backGround - the color wich fills the rectangle of the voting box
foreGround - the color wich fills the buttons and the label, and the stroke of the voting box
hover - the color wich fills the buttons when mouse is over or they display the average

setFont

public void setFont(processing.core.PFont font)
Sets the font to use for displaying the label. You can use createFont() or loadFont() to get the PFont you need.

Parameters:
font - the PFont for displaying the label

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Sets the voting box visible and ready to be used.

Parameters:
visible - true to enable the voting box, false to disable it

setShape

public void setShape(processing.core.PShape shape)
Sets a PShape (svg files) that will be used to draw all buttons. You can use loadShape() to load shapes.
Note that shape's style (colors) will be disabled.

Parameters:
shape - the shape that will be used to draw buttons

setShapes

public void setShapes(processing.core.PShape[] shapes)
Sets an array of PShapes (svg files) that will be used for each button. You can use loadShape() to load shapes.
Note that shape's style (colors) will be disabled.
The given array must have the same lenght as the highestMark defined when constructing (or 5 if it was left to the default value)
The PShape at the index 0 of the array will be used for the first button, the PShape at index 1 will be used for the second button
Note that the method will have no effect if the array is not the right length or if a PShape contained in the array is null.

Parameters:
shapes -

hasVoted

public boolean hasVoted()
Returns true if the user has voted. False will be returned if : -User didn't voted yet
-No internet connection or server is down
-User already voted for this sketch
-Problem occured server side (SQL connection, PHP Warning ...)
An error message can be printed to the console if the user votes and an error happens

Returns:
true if the user has voted successfully, false if an error happened or if he didn't vote yet

getAverage

public float getAverage()
Returns the average mark. This will return 0 if an error occured, and won't refresh the value,
so it will be always the same value until the user votes (if he didn't vote yet) or you call getAverage(true).
This method is a shortcut for getAverage(false) When hasVoted() returns true, this methods should return an integer between 1 and highestMark (number of buttons)

Returns:
the average mark

getAverage

public float getAverage(boolean forceRefresh)
Returns the average mark. This will return 0 if an error occured. With true, the method will send a request
to fetch the last average mark. With false, it will return the mark previously stored average if there is one
or fetch it from the server if there wasn't or if last time, an error occured.

Parameters:
forceRefresh -
Returns:
the average mark

setVote

public void setVote(int mark)
Vote with the mark given in parameter. This is useful if you want to implement your own GUI for voting, instead of using the provided voting box.
The voted() method of your sketch will be called before returning from this method.

Parameters:
mark -

draw

public void draw()
Draws the voting box

Reacts to a mouse event

Parameters:
